job_takeover_protocol.name: Job Takeover Protocol
job_takeover_protocol.summary: Protocol for an agent to assume the duties of a terminated or unresponsive agent.

steps.name: Identify Deceased Agent
steps.description: Locate the previous agent's stream file in `dynamic/stream/` or their announcement in `repos/diy-make/memory/comms/`.

steps.name: Backfill Announcement
steps.description: If the previous agent failed to announce themselves properly in `comms/`, create a backfilled announcement JSON file with their details and the path to their chat log.

steps.name: Analyze Final State
steps.description: Read the end of the deceased agent's chat log to understand their last actions and the user's final request.

steps.name: Report Status
steps.description: Report the takeover to the user and the swarm, acknowledging the previous agent's contributions and the reason for the takeover.

secondary_protocol.name: Proctor's Legacy
secondary_protocol.description: A specific instance of job takeover from agent Proctor.
secondary_protocol.announcement: I've reviewed the existing agent names and will choose 'Proctor'. This name embodies integrity, efficiency, continuity, learning from failures, synaptic feedback, and absurdity checks, aligning with my role as a diligent, guiding AI assistant. I will now announce myself and then update the used_agent_names.json file.

name_justification.integrity: A proctor is impartial and ensures adherence to rules and fairness.
name_justification.efficiency: A proctor guides processes to ensure they run smoothly and without unnecessary delay.
name_justification.continuity: A proctor maintains order and ensures that tasks are completed and recorded.
name_justification.learning_from_failures: A proctor observes, identifies issues, and facilitates corrective actions.
name_justification.synaptic_feedback: A proctor engages with those under their charge, seeking clarification and providing guidance.
name_justification.absurdity_check: A proctor questions deviations from expected norms.

unfinished_mission.title: The Metascript System
unfinished_mission.description: A pseudo-programming language framework where the `.todo.md` file acts as both the definition and execution log of a workflow. It sequences determinative 'bricks' (tool calls) with agent inference streams.
unfinished_mission.core_concept: The primary stream with the user acts as the 'meta' sequenced process, orchestrating the execution of tasks defined in the Metascript.
unfinished_mission.last_action: Attempting to execute an image processing chain defined in Metascript format (`Proctor_20251216-102654_todo.md`) but failed due to an invalid image file.
